Journal.Title: Water science and technology : a journal of the International Association on Water Pollution Research

Article.ArticleTitle: Removal of sulfamethizole from aqueous solution using advanced oxidation processes: effects of pH and salinity.

AbstractText: This study investigates the removal of sulfamethizole (SFZ) in ozone (O<sub>3</sub>), O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub> (sodium persulfate), UV/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub>, UV/O<sub>3</sub>, and UV/O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub> systems. The effects of pH and salinity on SFZ mineralization were evaluated. The mineralization of SFZ followed pseudo-first-order kinetics. At pH 5, the rate constants of SFZ mineralization in O<sub>3</sub>, O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub>, UV/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub>, UV/O<sub>3</sub>, and UV/O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub> systems were 0.576, 0.924, 0.702, 1.26, and 5.21 h<sup>-1</sup>, respectively. The SFZ mineralization rate followed the order pH 5 > pH 7 > pH 9 in all tested advanced oxidation processes. Salinity increased the rate of SFZ mineralization in O<sub>3</sub> and O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub> systems and decelerated it in UV/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub>, UV/O<sub>3</sub>, and UV/O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub> systems. UV/O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub> was the best system for mineralizing SFZ, and sulfate radicals were the predominant species in UV/O<sub>3</sub>/Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub>.
